narrative.narrative: London City Airways was a subsidiary of British Midland that was based at London City Airport from the airports opening in October 1987 until 1990. It was called Eurocity Express to start and was changed in 1988 to help it identify more with its hub. It began with two De Havilland Dash 7's and in 1988 ordered three new ones of which they were the last three Dash 7's ever made. It sold the two old ones and bought another used one from Maersk Air to make it four Dash 7's. It flew to Paris,Brussels and Amsterdam. It added Jersey later seasonal wise and did ad hoc charters too. It competed with Brymon Airways on the Paris route. It closed due to sustained financial losses in 1990 and the planes were transferred to its parent.
